org.purl.co.classes
Class StandardCOEnvironment<E>

java.lang.Object
  org.purl.co.classes.StandardCOEnvironment<E>
All Implemented Interfaces:
COEnvironment<E>
public class StandardCOEnvironment<E>
extends java.lang.Object
implements COEnvironment<E>

This class is the standard implementation of a @code{COEnvironment}.

Author:
Paolo Ciccarese, Silvio Peroni

Constructor Detail

StandardCOEnvironment

public StandardCOEnvironment()
Method Detail

createCOList

protected COList<E> createCOList(COList<E> coll)
                          throws ExistingCOEntityException

This method allows to use a different kinds of implementation of COList, rather than StandardCOList that is used as default by this class.

This method becomes particularly useful when we want to extend this class keeping the same behaviour except of using different kind of collection implementations. For lists, this can be easily implemented by overriding the public creation methods for lists as follows:

 public class NewCOEnvironment extends StandardCOEnvironment {
    ...
 
    public COList createCOList(URI id) throws ExistingCOEntityException {
       return super.createCOList(new MyOwnCOListImplementation(id, this));
    }
    
    public COList createCOList() {
       return super.createCOList(new MyOwnCOListImplementation(null, this));
    }
    
    ...
 }

Any element contained by the input list will be removed before returning.

Parameters:
coll - the list to be used for the creation.
Returns:
the input collection as part of the environment.
Throws:
ExistingCOEntityException - if the URI of the input collection has been previously used for another entity handled by this environment.

createCOList

public COList<E> createCOList(java.net.URI id)
                       throws ExistingCOEntityException
Description copied from interface: COEnvironment
This method creates a new CO list.

Specified by:
createCOList in interface COEnvironment<E>
Parameters:
id - the URI identifying to the new CO list or null if it is not associated to any identifier.
Returns:
a new CO list.
Throws:
ExistingCOEntityException - if the URI of the new collection has been previously used for another entity handled by this environment.

createCOBag

protected COBag<E> createCOBag(COBag<E> coll)
                        throws ExistingCOEntityException

This method allows to use a different kinds of implementation of COBag, rather than StandardCOBag that is used as default by this class.

This method becomes particularly useful when we want to extend this class keeping the same behaviour except of using different kind of collection implementations. For bags, this can be easily implemented by overriding the public creation methods for bags as follows:

 public class NewCOEnvironment extends StandardCOEnvironment {
    ...
 
    public COBag createCOBag(URI id) throws ExistingCOEntityException {
       return super.createCOBag(new MyOwnCOBagImplementation(id, this));
    }
    
    public COBag createCOBag() {
       return super.createCOBag(new MyOwnCOBagImplementation(null, this));
    }
    
    ...
 }

Any element contained by the input bag will be removed before returning.

Parameters:
coll - the bag to be used for the creation.
Returns:
the input collection as part of the environment.
Throws:
ExistingCOEntityException - if the URI of the input collection has been previously used for another entity handled by this environment.

createCOSet

protected COSet<E> createCOSet(COSet<E> coll)
                        throws ExistingCOEntityException

This method allows to use a different kinds of implementation of COSet, rather than StandardCOSet that is used as default by this class.

This method becomes particularly useful when we want to extend this class keeping the same behaviour except of using different kind of collection implementations. For sets, this can be easily implemented by overriding the public creation methods for sets as follows:

 public class NewCOEnvironment extends StandardCOEnvironment {
    ...
 
    public COSet createCOSet(URI id) throws ExistingCOEntityException {
       return super.createCOSet(new MyOwnCOSetImplementation(id, this));
    }
    
    public COSet createCOSet() {
       return super.createCOSet(new MyOwnCOSetImplementation(null, this));
    }
    
    ...
 }

Any element contained by the input set will be removed before returning.

Parameters:
coll - the set to be used for the creation.
Returns:
the input collection as part of the environment.
Throws:
ExistingCOEntityException - if the URI of the input collection has been previously used for another entity handled by this environment.

getCollection

public COCollection<E> getCollection(java.net.URI id)
Description copied from interface: COEnvironment
This method gets the collection associated to an input id, if it is contained in the environment.

Specified by:
getCollection in interface COEnvironment<E>
Parameters:
id - the URI identifying a collection.
Returns:
a COCollection object or 'null' if there not exist in the CO environment a collection with the input id.

Description copied from interface: COEnvironment
This method returns all the CO collections an object is part of.

Specified by:
elementOf in interface COEnvironment<E>
Parameters:
o - the object that is contained by some CO collections.
Returns:
a set of CO collections containing the object.

Parameters:
o - the object that is referred by some CO items.
Returns:

removeCollection

public boolean removeCollection(COCollection<E> coll)
Description copied from interface: COEnvironment
This method removes the collection specified as input from the environment.

Specified by:
removeCollection in interface COEnvironment<E>
Parameters:
coll - the collection to be removed.
Returns:
true if the collection has been removed, false otherwise (e.g., the collection is not part of the environment).

isCOEntityInEnvironment

public boolean isCOEntityInEnvironment(java.net.URI id)
Description copied from interface: COEnvironment
This method checks whether the input id is used for a particular CO entity (CO collection or item) within this environment.

Specified by:
isCOEntityInEnvironment in interface COEnvironment<E>
Parameters:
id - the URI to check.
Returns:
true if the URI is used for identifying a CO entity, false otherwise.

Specified by:
getCollections in interface COEnvironment<E>
Returns:
a set of all the collections in the environment.
